closed_reason: Already implemented by iteration 88t. Filter struct has Awaiting (*string) and AwaitingAny ([]string) fields with full Apply() support via matchesAwaiting() and matchesAwaitingAny() helpers. Manual=true mapped to 'work' for backwards compatibility. Comprehensive tests added.
description:
Add Awaiting field to the Filter struct in internal/query/filter.go

Current Filter struct has fields for: Owner, Status, Priority, Type, Label, LabelAny, Parent, TitleContains, DescContains, NotesContains

Add new field:
  Awaiting      *string   // Filter by awaiting type (nil = any, "" = none, value = specific)
  AwaitingAny   []string  // Match any of these awaiting types

Semantics:
- Awaiting == nil: no filter (show all)
- Awaiting == ptr("") : filter to awaiting is null (agent tasks)
- Awaiting == ptr("approval"): filter to specific type
- AwaitingAny: match any of the listed types

Update Apply() function to handle these fields.

This supports the --awaiting filter on tk list.
title: Add Awaiting filter to query.Filter struct
